title: MO DPS Private Contractors

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: MO DPS Private Contractors
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A list of private-sector security or investigation firms, companies, organizations, corporations, collaboratives or other entities contracting with Missouri Department of Public Safety to provide reporting of surveillance, security, intelligence or investigation for the purpose of public safety. 

I request that in conducting searches for releasable records, that you please disclose records even if they are currently available publicly through (your agency portal) other sources outside of your agency, such as the Missouri Accountability Portal or the National Archives and Records Administration

As the records sought detail the operations and activities of our government, I also request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use. 

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. However, as I am a member of the public and requesting documents specifically for the purpose of increasing the public’s knowledge of governmental functioning, I will administratively appeal any denial of my request for a fee waiver.  

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or USB thumb drive if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

title: University of Vermont - Cancellation of Mohammed El-Kurd event

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: University of Vermont - Cancellation of Mohammed El-Kurd event
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any incident report or similar record by UVM Police Services concerning the Miller Lecture Series event, originally planned for October 26, 2023, involving Mohammed El-Kurd.

2. Any correspondence sent to or from any of the following officials or offices (including any person employed by the office) between October 1, 2023 and October 22, 2023 which relates to the October 26 event or mentions any of the identified terms:
a. "Officials or offices" include: Division of Safety and Compliance, UVM Police Services, Adam White, or the Office of the President
b. "Terms" include: "Miller Lecture", "Mohammed", "El-Kurd"

3. Any records reflecting or substantiating the "conversations over the past week with community members, campus partners and public safety officials" referenced by UVM's statement to VT Digger, reported here:  https://vtdigger.org/2023/10/23/citing-safety-concerns-university-of-vermont-cancels-event-with-palestinian-writer.

4. Any records reflecting or substantiating the university's "assessment [...] that holding the event on campus this week raises safety and security concerns that cannot be sufficiently mitigated."

5. The incident reports for the following UVM Police Services reports: 23UV007799, 23UV007820, 23UV007913, 23UV007969.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Criminal Activity Nuisance Properties Ordinance Information Request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Criminal Activity Nuisance Properties Ordinance Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past three years (October 2020-October 2023) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance"  in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Criminal Activity Nuisance Properties" as described in Article III Sec. 34-73 through Sec. 34-78. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance

•  Notice to Vacate's filed by property owners as a result of nuisance abatement 

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance 

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

title: Legal Expenses Danbury, CT - Alves vs Giegler et al (Corporation Counsel, Danbury, CT)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide a list of all billable time for City of Danbury Corporation Counsel and administrative staff as well as outside counsel billing received before October 25, 2023 in connection with trial, appellate, and supreme court litigation of the Alves vs Giegler matter. Feel free to request any clarification you may need

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Paige

title: FOIA - Kodex (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to the your agency's contract with Kodex (https://kodex.us & https://www.kodexglobal.com/). These documents might include, but are not limited to, the following:

- Initial Bid Documents
- Current and previous contracts with Kodex
- Requests for Proposals
- Memorandum(s) of Understanding
- Any privacy impact assessments
- Any product manuals
- Any instructional materials or presentations
- Use policies and standard operating procedures
- Data retention policies
- Letters of Interest
- Usage policies
- Any informal agreements or other documents that reference "Kodex" or otherwise guide it use or the relationship between this agency and the provider or developer of the software.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader
